byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Under pressure of offerings from all over the world the pound sterling last week declined to $3.76 7/8, lowest since Sept. 15 last and beyond that the cheapest since April 28, 1933. The selling was predicated on the war fear that grips the world,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Under pressure of offerings from all over the world the pound sterling last week declined to $3.76 7/8, lowest since Sept. 15 last and beyond that the cheapest since April 28, 1933. The selling was predicated on the war fear that grips the world, forcing in particular the Continental European nations to convert sterling balances into dollars.

docs.snippet: Ambitious to succeed where Luis Angel Firpo of the Argentine failed sixteen years ago, Arturo Godoy, Chilean heavyweight, returned to this country yesterday for the purpose of fighting Joe Louis for the heavyweight title in Madison Square Garden,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ambitious to succeed where Luis Angel Firpo of the Argentine failed sixteen years ago, Arturo Godoy, Chilean heavyweight, returned to this country yesterday for the purpose of fighting Joe Louis for the heavyweight title in Madison Square Garden, Feb. 9.

headline.main: GODOY CONFIDENT OF BEATING LOUIS; Chilean Heavyweight Boasts of Newly Developed Left Hook for Title Fight PROMISES GREAT BATTLE Will Start Training at Camp in Summit, N.J., Next Month --Other Boxing News Weighs About 205 Pounds Roxborough Due Thursday

docs.lead_paragraph: Postmaster Albert Goldman urged the public yesterday to dispatch Christmas mail for European countries as early as possible this month if it is to reach the recipients in time for the holidays. His statement implied that war conditions might delay the mail, and he pointedout...
